Hi Izzy, I had a quick look at the bio they sent over to me but if you want to just give me a rundown of what you're currently doing and what you're thinking of doing in the future I'll see if I can help. Any questions you have, please ask and I'll do my best to answer them =]

Hey there! Im currently trying to get to grips with 3D animation, hoping for it to be one of my specialisms to take into my final year. Currently working on a body mechanics brief so for the end of this semester have to complete a Standing up, jumping, dance, and climb animation - all of which ive started but would appreciate feedback and help on! would like to get these body mechanic down so i can plan out some more animations to attempt over the summer. As for what im thinking of doing in the future, right now i think id like to go into film/tv animation not really too sure yet! hope this helps a bit :slightly_smiling_face:

Cool, ok. Well I'm happy to give feedback if you have links to your work.
Have you filmed any reference for the body mechanics stuff? If you're concentrating on body mechanics it's always good to film yourself or someone else acting the motion out. You might be surprised with some of the things you that you might not have realised. If you do it yourself you'll also be able to notice where all the weight shifting happens.
Which uni are you at if you don't mind me asking?
i havent filmed any reference actually ill def do that then thanks! I can upload my current work up onto one drive or smth and share the link with you to take a look at that would be great!
Im currently studying at DJCAD in Dundee!
